title: Missions should only apply to normals
body: I don't want to be in a ranked game where my teammates are stalling an early lead hunting for kills to reach their "10 kills/assists in two games" mission

replies.body: Honestly thats fair. Ranked shouldnt be influenced by quests like that, and I dont even play ranked.

We already have two similar systems that could already be affecting Ranked play by a small extent: Champion Mastery and Hextech Crafting.
In Champion Mastery, players might not want to play already mastered Champions or Champions that they already have all the Mastery Tokens for  for the current level because they want to progress in Mastery. This could cause players to play Champions they're worse at.
With Hextech Crafting, players might simply want to not play Champions they already got Hextech Chests on if they have a Hextech Chest available. EDIT: Additionally, they might try to do weird stuff like farm a ton or play Champions in off-roles to get S ranks.

I'm curious, do you support these systems as well?

The two systems are not similar enough. Since missions make you do very specific things while champion mastery only requires of you to do your best with a certain champion. You don't decide it's a good idea to first time a champion in ranked for and S rank, since it's harder to get an S rank in ranked overall.
You probably don't decide to do your Missions in Ranked either, for the exact same reason... From this point of view, the two systems are very similar.

It broadens your gameplay experience overall, but for the duration of the ranked match, you will be playing on a Champion you have less experience on. How much less experience - that is up to the player. Some player might his fourth best Champion, and another might play a mastery 1 Champion to get Mastery or a Hextech Chest. I know it's unlikely, I'm just saying that because the system exists, there is encouragement (however minor it may be) to play for alternative rewards instead of for the win.
It most certainly could affect ranked. You're assuming that players are going to play their better Champions, which will be the case most of the time, but because of the system, they have something that could be pushing them off the goal of winning. A player could go first time Azir in Ranked because she thought he was a counterpick to the enemy laner, or she could go first time Azir in Ranked because she wanted a Chest on Azir. You see?

Lastly, you did not address my point about Grades and Hextech Chests. Grades _generally_ align with winning actions, but sometimes players do stuff that is counterproductive to winning because they want a high grade. They'll farm side lanes and not group, they'll steal kills, they'll ward in inopportune areas, they'll never take risks to avoid dying, and more. Whatever it is they're doing, they're focusing on doing _that_ and not on focusing on doing what is right for the team.

I can see "normals only" missions extending to RGM/ARAM/TT as well (with some adjustments based on average stats from the map), but I don't think it should extend to ranked.

I guess its a fair priority but part of skill is teamwide decision making.  Backdooring to win through smart macro play where 4 buy time against 5 while one pushes won't give you kill credit and this game will prob give you a C+ or some shit score but it will secure the game in a vital moment and it is a display of skill.  

Promoting your damage dealers to dive and be flashy is already bad, the scoring system for example is horny for KDA.  It won't recognize when you're the one who dies to win a fight 1-5 to aggressively cc to deter someone from killing an ally.  We don't need more incentive to be a selfish show-off than there already is.  Daily missions are a good feature when handled responsibly, we aren't playing CoD.  Victory is determined through a variety of means and the missions should reflect that.  If they won't disabling them in Ranked should be a measure they take to prevent toxic behavior... though given the weird 10 bans system is hitting Ranked too I won't be surprised if these criticisms are ignored.

And by the way in HotS missions that are affected by your pick always autocomplete in raked. So if you have a quest for playing 3 games as an assassin and a quest to play 2 games as a Warcraft hero they will make progress with any hero.

I think all missions need to have a win condition attached to them.  So, if one of them is to "Play Ekko" and get free stuff, well that's great, but you should also have to WIN the game.  

And absolutely they should be left out of ranked.

I disagree, many missions involving accomplishing something in game require you to win the game and these missions are supposed to reinforce good gameplay, not create secondary objectives. The complaint shouldn't be to limit missions to normals, it should be to change a mission to better achieve reinforcing good gameplay. By stating the goal of the mission is to win the game with 10 kills/ assists, this makes it so that the goal of going for kills/assists should be to help your team win. Might cause a top laner to pick a teamfighting character like galio instead of his tryndamere main to do 2 birds with one stone. While missions would be easier in normals for many ranked players, the option is there, and is additive to gaining rank, not a seperate task that doesn't take into account winning or losing. As long as missions don't hinder the idea that the goal of ranked is to win, missions are fine. Many ranked players dont play normals anymore because its a less serious environment to them, if missions were only normal, then u force ranked players to play normal for rewards, or they ignore it. Missions for ranked is completely acceptable and the fear of their effects is basically the same fear already existing, the fear of someone throwing. But you will run into that no matter what, whether tilt or flame or some other reason. I personally believe missions will not affect ranked negatively.

As someone who saw first hand what adding some of the Battleground achievements to WoW did, this is a bad idea.  You do not want things that alter the way people play the game, because people who are trying to achieve them will get groups and manipulate games to do it.
